data.title: Constance Childs Is Married
data.text:
Constance Crimmins Childs, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Daniel R. Childs of New Canaan, Conn., was married yesterday to David Rosengarten, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Rosengarten of New York. The Rev. Michael C. Crimmins, the bride's cousin, performed the ceremony at St. Aloysius Roman Catholic Church in New York, assisted by Msgr.

Francis X. Maguire.

Florence Macdonald and Shirley B. Childs were their sister's matron and maid of honor, respectively. Lewis Rosengarten was best man for his brother.

The bride graduated from the Santa Catalina School in Monterey, Calif., and Skidmore College, where Mr. Rosengarten was formerly an assistant professor of theater. Her father is a partner in William A. M. Burden & Company, an investment concern in New York. Mrs. Rosengarten is a granddaughter of Shirley C. Burden of New York and Beverly Hills, Calif., and the late Flobelle Fairbanks Burden, Mrs. Frederick R. Childs of Noroton, Conn., and the late Mr. Childs. Mr. Burden is a photographer and chairman of the trustees' committee on photography at the Museum of Modern Art. Mr. Childs was an artist.

Mr. Rosengarten, a freelance writer, graduated cum laude from Colgate University, where he was elected to Phi Beta Kappa, and received a doctorate in theater arts from Cornell University, where he was a teaching assistant and an instructor in the summer session. His previous marriage ended in divorce. His father is president of Bolen Fasteners in New York.
